snippet: St. Louis County police officials said they were investigating Louis Head’s comments as part of a broader inquiry into the widespread violence following the grand jury’s decision.
abstract: Police in Ferguson, Mo, are investigating whether Louis Head, stepfather of Michael Brown, incited a riot by issuing an invective-filled call to action outside the police department after grand jury declined to indict police officer Darren Wilson in Brown's fatal shooting.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and MITCH SMITH
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Ferguson, and Mitch Smith from Chicago. John Eligon and Brent McDonald contributed reporting from Ferguson.

lead_paragraph: St. Louis County police officials said they were investigating Louis Head’s comments as part of a broader inquiry into the widespread violence following the grand jury’s decision.

headline.main: As National Guard Prepares to Leave Ferguson, Michael Brown’s Stepfather Faces Investigation
headline.print_headline: As Guard Begins Pullout, Stepfather of Ferguson Victim Is Under Investigation
